_header: Joy blessed Lady with pure virginal flower
Subjects: Virgin Mary, songs in honour of
_description: Gaude flore virginali — eight stanzas rhyme royal, each preceded by a Latin line, the first seven of which being with the word gaude

BLHar372.First Lines:
Ioy blissid lady with pure virgynal floureAnd honoure special
                    transcendyng vp on hee…
BLHar372.Last Lines:
…and with þi pitevous eeris here vs whan we callAnd
                    suffir vs neuer to þe fend to mak oure foulys thrall
BLHar372.Note:
Unique witness; Marian lyric, eight rhyme royal stanzas, each stanza
                    with a Latin heading, beginning, ‘Gaude flore virginali’ (f.
                    55); ends ‘Amen’ (f. 55v).
BLHar372.Editions:
Hammerle,  Karl. 
             “Die mittelenglische Hymnodie” 
             Anglia
         55 (1931): 412-30: 429-30.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 63-5.
